repnme.cdata!:
Uzbekistan - First Phase of the Drainage,
            Irrigation, and Wetlands Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Phase of the
            Drainage, Irrigation, and Wetlands Improvement Project for
            Uzbekistan were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: user participation is a new model that
            represents a new threat and an opportunity for both farmers
            and the local water authority. It is important that both
            parties know clearly the responsibilities and that there is
            an understanding of mutual dependence that needs to be
            adequately regulated in the laws governing both the water
            users' associations (WUAs) and the local and regional
            water authority. Distortions in production systems where the
            supply chain is largely controlled by the state and benefits
            are extracted from the region will undermine the production
            growth potential even after base agronomic conditions may
            have significantly improved. There is a need for better
            awareness of the administrative clearance process in country
            which can severely delay contract signature and procurement.
            While it is understandable that governments will like to see
            local contractors participate in bids as much as possible to
            build up the local contracting capacity, this usually
            entails increased supervision requirements and results in
            implementation delays as contractors often lack adequate
            equipment to perform the required tasks. A good results
            framework and strong monitoring and evaluation (M and E)
            system are critical to measuring project impacts.

repnme.cdata!:
Uzbekistan - Drainage, Irrigation, and
            Wetlands Improvement Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Drainage, Irrigation, and Wetlands Improvement Project for
            Uzbekistan is to increase the productivity of irrigated
            agriculture, employment and incomes in Karakalpakstan, one
            of the poorest regions in Central Asia. The project was
            approved in August 2006 and became effective on December 11,
            2006. The grant amount was USD 1,984,728.00. As of to-date,
            USD 901,802.19 has been disbursed. The closing date is
            December 11, 2011. All interim financial reports have been
            reviewed by the Bank and found to be satisfactory. Audit
            reports were unqualified, and there are no outstanding audit reports.

display_title.display_title:
Uzbekistan - Drainage,
            Irrigation, and Wetlands Improvement Project : restructuring
            (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Uzbekistan - Drainage, Irrigation, and
            Wetlands Improvement Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Drainage, Irrigation, and Wetlands Improvement Project for
            Uzbekistan is to improve the livelihoods of poor rural
            households (marginalized farmers and women) in the Turtkul,
            Ellikkala, Beruni, and Khujakli districts of Karakalpakstan
            through increased income generating opportunities from
            sericulture and silk production by establishing and
            sustaining community-based silk micro-enterprises while
            addressing the environmental degradation of the areas caused
            by the decline of the Aral Sea. The project has been rated
            satisfactory for progress towards development objectives and
            moderately satisfactory for implementation progress for the
            last 22 months. Regional water management staff and close to
            700 farmers have been trained, and training materials have
            been prepared. Compliance with the Bank safeguard policies
            is satisfactory, as is procurement and financial management.
            The reallocation is necessary to cover a deficit in the
            category 'South Karakalpakstan Collector Drain' in
            the amount of US$218,000, which was created due to exchange
            rate (UZS/USD) fluctuations. The required amount will be
            re-allocated from the category 'Unallocated.'

repnme.cdata!:
Uzbekistan - Drainage, Irrigation, and
            Wetlands Improvement Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Drainage, Irrigation, and Wetlands Improvement Project for
            Uzbekistan is to improve the livelihoods of poor rural
            households (marginalized farmers and women) in the Turtkul,
            Ellikkala, Beruni, and Khujakli districts of Karakalpakstan
            through increased income generating opportunities from
            sericulture and silk production by establishing and
            sustaining community-based silk micro-enterprises while
            addressing the environmental degradation of the areas caused
            by the decline of the Aral Sea. The project has been rated
            satisfactory for progress towards development objectives and
            moderately satisfactory for implementation progress for the
            last 22 months. Regional water management staff and close to
            700 farmers have been trained, and training materials have
            been prepared. Compliance with the Bank safeguard policies
            is satisfactory, as is procurement and financial management.
            The reallocation is necessary to cover a deficit in the
            category 'South Karakalpakstan Collector Drain' in
            the amount of US$218,000, which was created due to exchange
            rate (UZS/USD) fluctuations. The required amount will be
            re-allocated from the category 'Unallocated.'
